alert.note: Alert for Ashland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 6:32AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Southern portions of Ashland County Ohio. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding along the Black Fork of the Mohican River near Loudonville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 628 AM EST, gauge reports indicated minor flooding was ongoing along the Black Fork of the Mohican River near Loudonville. Flooding of other low lying or poor drainage areas is also possible. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Loudonville and Perrysville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
